references.B89DUN01NAUS: Dundee, H. A., and D. A. Rossman. 1989. The amphibians and reptiles of Louisiana. Louisiana State Univ. Press, Baton Rouge.
references.B89HIG01NAUS: Highton, R., G. C. Maha, and L. R. Maxson. 1989. Biochemical evolution in the slimy salamanders of the PLETHODON GLUTINOSUS complex in the eastern United States. Illinois Biological Monographs 57:1-153.
references.B05ANT02USGP: Anthony, C.D. 2005. Plethodon kisatchie Highton 1989: Louisiana Slimy Salamander. Pp. 820-821. In: Lannoo, M. (Ed.), Amphibian Declines: The Conservation Status of United States Species. University of California Press. Berkeley and Los Angeles, California.
references.W14IUC99USGP: IUCN. 2014. The IUCN Red List of Threatened Species. Version 2014.1. http://www.iucnredlist.org. Downloaded March 2016.
references.B95WIL01NCGP: Wilson, L. A. 1995. The Land Manager's Guide to the amphibians and reptiles of the South. Chapel Hill, NC: The Nature Conservancy.

habitat_description: Known from the hill parishes on north central Louisiana, Plethodon kisatchie occurs in hardwood and occasionally pine forests under downed logs and vegetation debris (Dundee and Rossman 1989, Highton et al. 1989, Anthony 2005).
